website_summaries.verdict: Has almost everything budget-conscious consumers want: brand name, good price, build quality, durability, ease of use, and impressive lift range.
pros: A compact floor jack made of solid steel
As versatile as most larger models
Fits most compact and low-setting cars
can obtain a height of around 18 inches
cons: Only capable of lifting 2-ton vehicles, though this weight rating is acceptable for most
Surprisingly heavy for its low-profile size

website_summaries.verdict: Perhaps not an ideal choice for a car trunk, but excellent as a compact service jack in a garage or shop. Low profile means it will still get under modified or foreign-built vehicles.
pros: Compact design, with a low 3.5" clearance
Ready to work straight out of the box
Solid hydraulics, with very controlled release
cons: Can require frequent bleeding due to trapped air

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty jack, lifts easy Update: This jack started leaking oil from the second use
customer_reviews.author: Kalid

customer_reviews.title: Broke first day
customer_reviews.text: Today was my very first day using this Jack. And to put it simply, it broke. Thank the heavens it wasnt a catastrophic failure, but some piece that connects the hand pump to the actual lift must have disconnect. My car was stuck suspended in the air and I had to run out and get a new Jack to get this one out from under. I have a small BMW coupe, well under the weight restrictions of this Jack and I was only jacking a corner at a time for wheel changes. I did read all the instructions before using. Avoid this at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Great jack with lots of control and fits under low cars with ease
customer_reviews.text: Great jack for lowered cars! It's quite heavy and extremely well made. Rolls easily though on the garage floor. The padded handle has lots of control too for slowly and carefully lowering it back down. After using the stock jack for the past couple years for all my automotive projects I wish I got this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: ndtinker

customer_reviews.title: Low profile is nice - so that I can slip a BMW specific ...
customer_reviews.text: This is steel - so it is heavy. And heavy duty. Low profile is nice - so that I can slip a BMW specific jack pad atop. Floor jack was primed and ready to use (out of the box) in two minutes. Very smooth up and down action. I needed one delivered overnight - and this floor jack was available to ship overnight - and I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Reilly

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend spending the few extra bucks on an Arcan jack
customer_reviews.text: If you can, I'd recommend spending the few extra bucks on an Arcan jack, you won't be disappointed. My buddy has the aluminum version of this jack, which is really nice if you ever have to carry it around or lift it into the back of your truck and take it off site. I can get away with the steel version because it'll just stay in my garage. Either way these are good jacks at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis N

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous! The round cup that the vehicle rests on is small and has very tiny side walls.
customer_reviews.text: I had two different vehicles fall off the jack before I had time to add the jack stands. The cup is the biggest issue. It's tiny without any good side wall to prevent the cup from sliding on the frame or any other location you jack up. The worse is if you have any oily residue on your vehicle it will slip off this jack. I had an old jack that I used for 15 years and I never had any vehicle fall off of it. DO NOT USE THIS WITHOUT JACK STANDS !!
customer_reviews.author: fj nick

customer_reviews.title: Great Floor jack for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing floor jack! This lifted my Honda Pilot without an issue. I was able to slide my ramps underneath for demonstration purposes. I would highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Prizoneroffaith

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack - Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Works flawlessly and comes with easy to follow instructions for initial setup. Only had this for a couple weeks but I've used it on my van and small car multiple times since and it's been great. Well worth the extra money from a cheap trolley jack that takes a hundred pumps and isn't as stable. Height is good. I will update next summer after I get some more use out of it. If it was lighter, I would give 5-star. It moves really easily (loudly) over the ground, but carrying it from the garage is a PITA. 65lbs I think. Doable, but I would love a 50-lbs racing jack.
customer_reviews.author: Marty_5000

customer_reviews.title: No issues after 9 months of light use
customer_reviews.text: I use this to lift the cars onto jack stands when rotating tires or doing other work. No issues so far. The four wheels aren't perfectly level but it flattens out under load. Probably no more than 1 or 2mm of twist in it, and it doesn't affect functionality. You rotate the handle to open/close the hydraulics. A very light twist is all it takes to lock her in place. The handle is padded where it counts which is great since this lives around cars. It lifts high enough for 17" jack stands but not much more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great, quality jack.
customer_reviews.text: While I have only had this a short time, it is a quality piece of gear. Used to help replace engine mounts on my BMW 335i. Used it to lift the car to place of jacks...it is easy to maneuver and effortless to operate. Feels very solid and strong, but ergonomic as well. Packaging was adequate and assembly was a snap. Will have to wait and see on reliability but so far, very happy with my purchase. Update: Two years later and multiple lifts it is still working great. Only thing that happened was the rubber piece fell out of the lift pad. I am probably going to buy a second one.
customer_reviews.author: AndyW

customer_reviews.title: Works well until air is trapped requiring routine bleeding to restore lift
customer_reviews.text: Profile is excellent for a low slung vehicle such as a Mini Cooper. After about two days of moderate use, the jack repeatedly required maintenance to release trapped air. This is a nuisance in the middle of a job. When operational the jack is a very smooth to operate and lifts to an adequate height for most jobs in a home shop. I haven't owned the unit long enough to access durability.
customer_reviews.author: ArtHistory

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, works as expected
customer_reviews.text: As many 2-Ton jacks, this isn't extremely easy to maneuver and the wheels tend to leave marks on my epoxy-coated garage floor, but it works well. If your car has minimal clearance underneath like an Audi or Porsche, this is a great jack. The handle is pretty long, so make sure you have some clearance on the sides of your workspace for that. Folds away relatively nicely and stores easily, also.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Best jack for the sub $150 price point!
customer_reviews.text: This jack is awesome. It reached all the way under my 1999 M3 and I was able to jack the entire front end up from the crossbeam, allowing me to insert my floor jacks. And my car is pretty low. It only takes about 5 or 6 pumps to reach maximum height. It even looks nice in black. If you don’t need 20 plus inches in jacking height for SUVs and will just primarily use this for lowered or regular height cars... this is the jack for you.
customer_reviews.author: orandy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to move around but heavy to lift ; good quality
customer_reviews.text: This works well to lift my Nissan Leaf (compact car). Do yourself a favor and get a low profile jack, unless you drive a truck (but then those jacks are probably rated much higher than 2 tons). The surface is flat with a few rubber bumps. I put an adapter on it for pinch welds. It jacks the car WAY up in only a few easy pumps, but you can also lift it very slowly.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew from San Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Floor Jack Tackles Tacoma
customer_reviews.text: I used this to upgrade the leaf springs on my 2017 Toyota Tacoma. This jack held the truck up solidly throughout the whole job. Assembly was easy and it was delivered in good condition. I wish releasing pressure while the truck is lifted was a bit more softly regulated but then again the jack does have a couple tons of truck on it. If you need a low profile floor jack for diy jobs around the house pick this up. You will not be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: DonKarnage223

customer_reviews.title: 2 Years Of Use...
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years, and many hours of holding up various vehicles, this jack is a winner. I love that it can still be used to jack a car up with very little clearance to pump the dandle, still works like a charm. While its light enough to maneuver, it's not exactly light weight, but who cares, it's a car jack, isn't supposed to be light. Excellent product, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Sotep

customer_reviews.title: Not professional grade
customer_reviews.text: A bit smaller than my other jacks and doesn't lift as high, but other than that, it seems to work. Wouldn't reccomend for a professional shop but for a DIY it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Don't Buy This Jack
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jack in the fall of 2018. It sat in my garage, in the box, unopened until Spring of 2019. I used it to lift each corner of a car so I could get it up on jack stands. Then I used it to get the same car off the jack stands. By the end of that use it was pretty much garbage. The male fitting in the jack that fits the female end of the handle completely stripped out and now is completely rounded off after only minor use. And now I couldn't return it because it sat around so long before I started my project.
customer_reviews.author: Rev1216

customer_reviews.title: Quality Floor Jack for Home Use:
customer_reviews.text: This jack is much bigger than my previous, but much easier to use overall. It supports vehicle weight effortlessly, which is what I like. Quality built & nicely finished, all Yeses! My old hydraulic jack is 30 years old & was a cheap model. This one offers the lows & high lifts needed for most vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Bru-sky

customer_reviews.title: Great jack.
customer_reviews.text: More jack than I needed. In that I mean it is better quality and well built more for someone using it daily. I needed it as a just in case lift jack. I like the low profile and high lift. It's a bit heavier than I expected, but I can deal with it. ( I store it in the bed of a pickup and have to lift it up or down to use it or store it ) If you need a good jack for daily use, this is the one. If you want a well built sturdy jack for weekends or light duty, you can't go wrong with this model.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack
customer_reviews.text: I love this jack! My car is a little too low so I still need low profile ramps in order to get a couple extra inches of clearance to reach the center jacking point but that is no fault of the jack. I have not had any issues with leaks. I can gracefully lower my car with this jack. The previous one i had lasted about 6 months before it dropped my car abruptly each time I tried lowering it. This jack has helf up very well. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Alex 13

customer_reviews.title: Jacking made easy!
customer_reviews.text: Its not as "low profile" as it sounds bc it still wont fit under my 370z that is only lowered an inch but i do have some sideblades installed so that didnt help. It does work great for my other cars. It makes it effortless to raise up your car and its so easy to roll around! Super duty too! For the price I would say its still worth, It is lower profile than those $50 jacks that you get from auto parts stores. I was just disapointed it wont work with my Z but it works well on my 07 bmw 335, 04 bmw 335ci, and 03 is300 all lowered on H&R springs.
customer_reviews.author: Shawad

customer_reviews.title: Missing retainer clip on wheel
customer_reviews.text: decent jack for the price. Had it for about 2 months before I used it. Opened it and it was missing the retainer clip to hold a wheel on. Still usable but have to push or pull it a certain way or the wheel falls off. Doesn’t make it dangerous to use. Just make sure the wheel is on before jacking your vehicle
customer_reviews.author: Mike Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Great for jacking up my E93
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for another jack that had problems with its handle. This jack works great for my E93, and is nice and easy to use. The rubber coating on the handle is a nice touch, and makes sure that you don't scratch anything when the jack bumps up against the bottom of your car. So far it's working well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Veloso

customer_reviews.title: Cheap jack
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was buying something quality till it broke first day I used it. I wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.author: Michael Reedom

customer_reviews.title: I use this a TON (hehe)
customer_reviews.text: I never took the time to invest in a nice, low profile jack like this. This makes it so easy to get the car jacked up. Before it took about 15 minutes for me to get both sides jacked up and jack stands set up. With this, I up and working in 2-3 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: does not rise fast, kind of cheap. made more for home light use. Harbor Freight has a better one 3 ton for 1/2 the price!
customer_reviews.author: James F.

customer_reviews.title: then you NEED to get yourself a great jack. Not those cheap 50 dollar ones
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to work on your car, then you NEED to get yourself a great jack. Not those cheap 50 dollar ones. You need a QUALITY jack that can make a huge difference in safety and time. This jack is perfect. With 10 pumps, I can lift my car at its highest. The quality is GREAT and very easy to set up. It's also low-profile so you can use it on almost every car. I use this and 2 jack (3 ton) jack stands when I work on my car. Safety is important. If you have a spare tire, throw that under the car too for extra safety.
customer_reviews.author: DaftPunked

customer_reviews.title: Great price for the quality and lifts well. 2 Ton Steel.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first jack I have purchased for myself and it is great so far! I've used it a few times already and I am happy with its lifting power. I bought the 2 ton steel jack because I wanted to save some money and I have a concrete driveway. Rolls very well. There are some instructions to follow to get any possible air out of the system and I am sure some people may skip that step and then they think the jack is terrible at lifting. I would recommend this product to anyone who just works on their vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Hermenegildo

customer_reviews.title: Just burn your money instead, its more enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: This vehicle lifted my car one time....thats it....its been a garage paperweight ever since. Wont even go more than halfway up on its own and if you stand on it, it goes right back 5o the ground. Gigantic waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: Not cool !
customer_reviews.text: After a few minutes it leaks down. I would like to return it but maybe it is too late to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Broedel

customer_reviews.title: Nice but wish it jacked higher
customer_reviews.text: I like this jack alot but i wish it went three inches higher I still have to use blocks of wood when jacking up my challenger. If your gonna make a low profile jack retain the max height dont shave it off and be done with it....
customer_reviews.author: August Will Decay

customer_reviews.title: Good compromise between height, weight, and price.
customer_reviews.text: At least one year later, I'm happy with this tank. Hasn't leaked, fits under most low profile vehicles. Bought it for a Challenger with optional Track suspension so I could eliminate driving up on blocks first. Also works on a lowered Miata. Best compromise I found between height and lifting power. I might have bought the longer version of this if I was to do it all over again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great Product at Great Price
customer_reviews.text: After researching many products before purchasing my first floor jack, I settled on the Arcan XL20, and I'm sure glad I did. I love getting a quality tool at a fair price, and this fits the bill. It's made so many jobs faster and easier. I liked it so much I'm buying another one!
customer_reviews.author: lomowen

customer_reviews.title: Jack can't keep it up
customer_reviews.text: The jack started sagging after a few months and now I have to quickly put jack stands under my car because it will not hold the weight. I tried bleeding the air from it and it didn't help.
customer_reviews.author: electronic life

customer_reviews.title: Does the job. Safely
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine for me, lifts the car high enough to work under it, no leaks, no sounds.. yes heavy, but for a DIY person. Just fine
customer_reviews.author: Pedro A. Villena

customer_reviews.title: Nice and low and works very well
customer_reviews.text: Nice and low and works very well. It gets under my C7 Corvette with side skirts with an inch to spare and will get both wheels off the ground on the side I'm lifting on. The control for lowering is slow and easy. I definitely would recommend for use with sports cars.
customer_reviews.author: TomKat

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the price
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly as expected. For the price, you cannot beat this. I bought a low profile racing jack from Harbor Freight that leaked oil on the first use. I replaced it with this jack, and have not regrets so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D.

customer_reviews.title: easy to maneuver on flat surface
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy but well built, easy to maneuver on flat surface. I purchased it used but you wouldnt know it, looks like it has never been used. Lifts quickly and is easy to control the release so you can let vehicle down easily.
customer_reviews.author: Doug P

customer_reviews.title: check the screws n bolts
customer_reviews.text: the one i received had 2 screws loose albeit in a non essential part ( cover plate between the handle and lifting arm) but i checked them al for safety.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good piece
customer_reviews.text: It is a little lower at its top height then expected, this is probably something I missed. Also it is used for at home work and the wheels are getting beat up pretty bad just running it over our back porch and paved driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Gettin' It Done!

customer_reviews.title: I feel like a pro with this thing after using a $40 ...
customer_reviews.text: I feel like a pro with this thing after using a $40 craftsman jack for the past 12 years. As everyone has noted it's heavy, really heavy. My guess is about 60lbs. But it moves around easily and raises my 3 series bmw with just a few pumps. Seems very well built, hoping it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Great jack for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great jack for the price. I used it this weekend to work on my Dad's saturn and my suburban. Worked as well or better than I expected. Was very easy to operate one handed while working. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: good jack for the price
customer_reviews.text: i've not had it long enough to to tell how well it will hold up. so far i'm pleased with it, all FOUR touch the floor unlike my last jack. it lifts my car without much effort and performs as advertised. my only complant is that it is heavy, but what can you expect, it's made of steel and a light weight aluminum jack is three times as much and you may not get all four wheels on th ground even at that price.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: It's junk sorry to say. Currently in my carport stuck in the up position and the post handle and connection point to the jack are stripped out after two uses. I would plan on two maybe three uses and then throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Lubricant after a few uses, Breaks after a year
customer_reviews.text: Ive only used this jack a handful of times in emergency situations, but after the third use the lubricant started leaking. And while roadside and needing the jack after a tire popped, the attachment linking the handle to the jack tore off, rendering it useless and a 70lbs paper weight in a situation where it needed to step up. Not worth the premium over other $60 floor jacks.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell gil

customer_reviews.title: Can't really say much more than what's already been posted ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't really say much more than what's already been posted about this jack, this was a replacement for a Craftsman which finally gave out, leaking fluid all over the garage floor. What a difference. So much easier to use, and very solid. I used to dread the bi-yearly wheel changes on my car (snow tires/wheels on in the fall, OEM's back on in spring), no longer. Changing the wheels now is so much less of a chore.
customer_reviews.author: Greg29

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assermble and works as Excpected
customer_reviews.text: Very good floor jack for the weekend mechanic like myself
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stone

customer_reviews.title: 2011 Subaru STI
customer_reviews.text: Fits well under bumper. I like driving the front on ramps first, but that's only so I can see precisely where I'm jacking it up. Installing coilovers and I know this jack will still be good to use.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Super high quality
customer_reviews.text: Super high quality. A++ Speed jack lifts cars with no struggle. Wish the stroke was shorter hard to use in close confines. Super heavy at 67 pounds. Make sure you can lift that to get it out of the box. Which was packed amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great jack. Good clearance for low cars (in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Great jack. Good clearance for low cars (in my case Subaru BRZ) and the included rubber pad helps protect the front cross member from any scratches.
customer_reviews.author: ♚ ♛ ♜ ♝ ♞ ♟ ♔ ♕ ♖ ♗ ♘ ♙

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great Jack for the money. Sure you can get a really nice $500 (or more!) jack but unless you've got a car repair business, its not worth it. If you're a driveway, occasional repair guy (or girl) like me then this is all you need.
customer_reviews.author: awesome i love it

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it should do, and well
customer_reviews.text: A good-quality low-profile floor jack, more than capable of doing its job. An important point to note is that with care, one can manage to slowly return the lifted vehicle to the garage floor or driveway. Sturdy, relatively simple assembly, and a purchase with which I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Perry Clark

customer_reviews.title: VERY NICE FLOOR JACK Would buy again! Heavy but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT Floor Jack! HEAVY DUTY! VERY Well made--nothing flimsy here! just keep it well lubed so it doesn't rust if used in a high humidity enviornment.
customer_reviews.author: HKUSPc

customer_reviews.title: Just works on all my cars/trucks
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Perfect for my large van. The package was significantly damaged but the jack itself was just fine
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my full size sedan
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly on my 2011 BMW 740i for an oil change and to add some wheel spacers. Combined this with some ESCO 10498 (short) jack stands and Was good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Evert Estrada

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Very nice so far. Very light weight for its size. Lifts my Yukon XL with a 2" lift kit with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent jack use for oil changes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent jack. Use to lift sports car to perform oil changes. Raise car and block to secure car
customer_reviews.author: DHR

customer_reviews.title: Great product/ lousy shipping
customer_reviews.text: Jack is perfect. The shipping was a problem. Set up to do work on my daughters car. The shipping was a late and I had to go buy one the day we planned for. The minute my daughter drove away the jack showed up
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: fit under front axle of 1966 chevy van (it's a street sweeper) great action, rolls very smoothly even in grass
customer_reviews.text: Used once so far, fit under front axle of 1966 chevy van (it's a street sweeper) great action, rolls very smoothly even in grass. Very happy, would reccomend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle keeps snapping
customer_reviews.text: So when ever i lower the lift the handle snaps in the middle of the turn which i had to push it forward everytime to lock it.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad Justanieah

customer_reviews.title: This jack is perfect. Lifts car pretty fast and stable
customer_reviews.text: This jack is perfect. Lifts car pretty fast and stable. It does lower a bit fast, but safely. If your gentle with the handle, you can control the lower rate. Box came a little jack up...lol.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Beefy as HELL!
customer_reviews.text: This lift is beefy as HELL! Very tall reach for a low profile unit. In the end, that's what we all want. Good unit. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: PaulChick1

customer_reviews.title: Missing part?
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts out of the box? The "square" circle on the handle is much too large to turn the nub inside the jack. Am i missing a piece? Just unboxed it... Boxed it is very heavy. Don't want to have to return it
customer_reviews.author: Elicansmile

customer_reviews.title: Really nice high quality jack
customer_reviews.text: Really nice high quality jack. Love the extra low profile. Makes it a lot easier to get under my 350Z.
customer_reviews.author: Greg W.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Vest bargain! A little heavy, but best Jack I have ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: Your average consumer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality everything
customer_reviews.text: Great quality everything. Cannot complain about anything. Jacks up the car super fast too. Way less work than I'm used to expending to jack up a car.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice low profile jack
customer_reviews.text: Very low profile. I had a flat on the front of my firebird which made it very difficult to get under to jack it up. This managed to slide underneath the frame (not by much mind you). Feels very solidly made and as others have said, heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Racer X

customer_reviews.title: Great jack
customer_reviews.text: Nice jack and no issues with it’s use. Lifted my 2015 Toyota Tundra with no problem. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Drayer

customer_reviews.title: Great jack
customer_reviews.text: Using this for my B8.5 s4, does a great job!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Cain

customer_reviews.title: So far this jack is perfect for my Mini Cooper
customer_reviews.text: So far this jack is perfect for my Mini Cooper. I needed a jack that could get under my car. This jack really looks and feels high quality. Only time will tell if it hold up. I will update if I notice any quality issues.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Dick

customer_reviews.title: Great low profile jack
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2007 Z4, and getting a jack under it can be a challenge. This jack does the job - it's smooth and easy to operate. The only criticism is that the instructions were a little vague, and there is a shipping wire securing the lever action that has to be cut, since it wouldn't pry off.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Koziar

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this jack. Needed it for a low clearance car, works great!
customer_reviews.author: TallDude

customer_reviews.title: Great jack for the money
customer_reviews.text: Everything here works exactly as advertised. I bought this to use on my 2019 Mustang GT. It fits easily under the car, and lifts it effortlessly. The Jack is heavy, but I already knew it would be. I’m very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Good Jack
customer_reviews.text: Works well as expected. Easily slides under low cars like my Corvette. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good utility floor jack
customer_reviews.text: Performs well, as expected. Easy to use. It is low so positioning clearance is not a problem. However, I now find that a higher lift would be more to my liking. OTOH, the base of this unit is short and maneuverable in tight spaces, which would not be possible with a higher lift jack.
customer_reviews.author: dblnkl

customer_reviews.title: Great jack, at an even greater price!
customer_reviews.text: Great jack; works flawlessly and at about $100 less than AutoZone, how can you miss? Very high quality, well made, and sturdy. My last floor jack (sold before moving) was a Craftsman with the "Quick-Lift". I could not stand that jack, as it just never seemed to work right and needed a lot more pumping of the handle to raise the vehicle the way a standard floor jack would. Therefore, when looking for a jack this time, I was sure to avoid any of those gimmicky, Quick-Lift jacks. I'm glad I did, this Arcan is fantastic. The quality is just as good as the Craftsman fancy jack, and possibly better. With Amazon Prime and free shipping, you can't miss.
customer_reviews.author: Terry T.

customer_reviews.title: Great jack, good price, looks good.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great jack. I've had nothing but success with it and I'd highly recommend for anyone looking to scoop a floor jack.
customer_reviews.author: Sean L.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Jack If Your On A Budget
customer_reviews.text: I use this jack for my 98 gmc 2500 95 Buick P/A 03 Honda Element, it's well built an the price doesn't hurt the wallet too bad..I've had name brand Jack's but this by far works the best
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good for those with coil overs.
customer_reviews.text: This baby is a beast. Our lowered (coil over) BMW is only 6.something inches off the ground in the front, and this gets under there to do the job. Note that it is extremely heavy and is not easy to lug around, but that is going to be true of any jack.
customer_reviews.author: tjc

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellently performing jack. Let me make myself perfectly clear; these are not the jacks that you might have purchased 20 years ago that were low priced, questionable for strength, stability and durability. It is light in weight, it is low for confined clearances, and the let down speed it easily controllable for as gentle a set down as you would want. I am so impressed by the quality and performance of this jack, I just ordered a 3-ton aluminum version from Arcan. These jacks are as good as anything I have experienced in 50 years of automotive repair.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: terrible floor jack~
customer_reviews.text: can not lift my car off the ground... super poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Benz-W

customer_reviews.title: All jacked up!
customer_reviews.text: Two is better than one. Bought this jack again after owning one. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Atheniakid

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and the low profile helps on some low coupes
customer_reviews.author: mlarson

customer_reviews.title: Don't think we'll ever need another
customer_reviews.text: My fiance wanted something sturdy that would last. He opened the package immediately and jacked up his car, even though he wasn't working on it. He was very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Mason

customer_reviews.title: a good low profile jack
customer_reviews.text: When the warranty period on my BM535 xi wagon expired it was time to do the oil changes myself. Three items are needed: a good low profile jack, the BMW jack pad adapter and the Assenmacher oil filter wrench. All three items are available from Amazon and all three deserve five stars.
customer_reviews.author: frose2

customer_reviews.title: Bent underneath
customer_reviews.text: I received my lift jack today and noticed that underneath it is a bit bent. I am not sure if it is still safe to use?
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Rosas

customer_reviews.title: Very low profile for lower cars, solid and heavy, excellent reach and height.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and perfect for lower cars as well as larger vehicles
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Item as described
customer_reviews.text: This is a Christmas gift for my father. Don't know how it performs yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ensminger

customer_reviews.title: Nice low jack.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice sturdy jack. It picks up my vehicles with ease. It gets under my 93 Corvette.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my home garage.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good for my home use. I dont run a garage but I do look after 4 family cars, that require oil, atf, brake, tires etc and this jack has saved my back. No more regular car jacks for me. I dont know why it took me so long to buy this jack.
customer_reviews.author: scubaman

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack
customer_reviews.text: I've had this one for several years now and has not failed me once. I am a weekend mechanic so it does not get used every day. But I highly recommend it for its sturdiness and low profile
customer_reviews.author: Jose Cruz-Toledo

customer_reviews.title: Low Pad Height is the Plus
customer_reviews.text: Good Jack, Like the low pad height, fits easily under my lowered Mustang. Much more controllable when lowering the car than my old one. Delivered with packaging intact. No damage. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Great jack been using it a lot here lately
customer_reviews.text: Great jack been using it a lot here lately, Definitely makes it easier to work on my vette and wife's truck.
customer_reviews.author: Chazz Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Great smooth lifting action as well as smooth lowering action
customer_reviews.text: Fit under my lowered car as expected. I may go a bit lower on the car which will then have some clearance problems, but I'll just drive onto some 2x10s for extra clearance. Great smooth lifting action as well as smooth lowering action.
customer_reviews.author: c00lduke

customer_reviews.title: Great jack
customer_reviews.text: It worked great rebuilding my camaro so it was a great help and much needed took
customer_reviews.author: Donald DiebelDiebel

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my use.
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far for my needs. The low profile is a definite plus in many situations. It is a replacement for an old Sears jack (about 40 years old) that I could not find repair parts for.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Great investment
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to maneuver around and under a vehicle. Light weight. Very manageable.
customer_reviews.author: Mama B

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic brute of a floor jack.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a brute. I really like the quality. Sure, it’s heavy, but works great for my garage floor and I like the rapid pump. This was a huge upgrade to my other style jack. Like the rubber on the handle to protect what your lifting. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: Received on time and undamaged. The jack works as advertised and is a good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch

product_meta.title: Arcan 2 Ton Low Profile Quick Rise Steel Floor Jack XL20,Black
product_meta.description: The Arcan jack is a sleek, low profile, durable, and long lasting 2T steel service jack capable of taking on any job for professionals or weekend warriors. The Arcan true low profile design allows users to get under almost any vehicle to lift and comes at a significantly lower cost compared to other models in the market. This model passes the 2009 ASME PALD standard, which is the industry's leading safety regulation for lifting equipment. Lift Capacity (tons) : 2
feature_bullets: LOW PROFILE FRAME: For easy access under low ground clearance vehicles.
DUAL PUMP PISTONS: Quickly raises the floor jack saddle to load.
UNIVERSAL JOINT RELEASE MECHANISM: Provides precise control of jack.
STEEL CONSTRUCTION: For heavy duty use.
VEHICLE PROTECTION: Designed with a rubber saddle and a foam handle bumper.
2 PIECE HANDLE: Allows for easy storage.
BYPASS AND OVERLOAD VALVES: Prevents over-extension of hydraulic ram and jack use beyond rated capacity.
COMPLIES WITH ASME PASE-2014 SAFETY STANDARD: We put all of our lifting equipment through a voluntary and rigorous safety certification process.
